section.title: Create a SUSE-based Virtual Appliance Template in vCenter

step.para: Download the &sle_repo; ISO image (SLE-12-SP3-Server-DVD-x86_64-GM-DVD1.iso) and the &slsa; SDK ISO (SLE-12-SP3-SDK-DVD-x86_64-GM-DVD1.iso) from . You need to sign in or create a &suse; customer service account before downloading.
Create a new Virtual Machine in vCenter Resource Pool.
Configure the Storage selection.
Configure the Guest Operating System.
Create a Disk.
Ready to Complete.
Edit Settings before booting the VM with additional Network Settings, Memory.
Attach the ISO image to the DataStore.
Configure the 'disk.enableUUID=TRUE' flag in the General - Advanced Settings.
After attaching the CD/DVD drive with the ISO image and completing the initial VM configuration, power on the VM by clicking the Play button on the VM's summary page.
Click Installation when the VM boots from the console window.
Accept the License agreement, language and Keyboard selection.
Select the System Role to Xen Virtualization Host.
Select the 'Proposed Partitions' in the Suggested Partition screen.
Edit the Partitions to select the 'LVM' Mode and then select the 'ext4' filesystem type.
Increase the size of the root partition from 10GB to 60GB.
Create an additional logical volume to accommodate the LV_CRASH volume (15GB).
Configure the Admin User/Password and User name.
Installation Settings (Disable Firewall and enable SSH).
The operating system will be successfully installed and the VM will reboot.
Check that the contents of the ISO files are copied to the locations shown below on your &clm;. This may already be completed on the &clm;.

listitem.para: The contents of the &slsa; SDK ISO (SLE-12-SP3-SDK-DVD-x86_64-GM-DVD1.iso) must be mounted or copied to /opt/ardana_packager/ardana/sles12/zypper/SDK/ (create the directory if it is missing). If you choose to mount the ISO, we recommend creating an /etc/fstab entry to ensure the ISO is mounted after a reboot.
Mount or copy the contents of SLE-12-SP3-Server-DVD-x86_64-GM-DVD1.iso to /opt/ardana_packager/ardana/sles12/zypper/OS/ (create the directory if it is missing).
Mount or copy the contents of SLE-12-SP3-SDK-DVD-x86_64-GM-DVD1.iso to /opt/ardana_packager/ardana/sles12/zypper/SDK/.

step.para: Log in to the VM with the configured user credentials.
The VM must be set up before a template can be created with it.
The VM should now have four network interfaces. Configure them as follows:
The directory will contain the files: ifcfg-br0, ifcfg-br1, ifcfg-br2, ifcfg-br3, ifcfg-eth0, ifcfg-eth1, ifcfg-eth2, and ifcfg-eth3.
If you have configured a default route while installing the VM, then there will be a routes file.
Note the IP addresses configured for the MGMT and ESX_CONF.
Delete all the bridge configuration files, which are not required: ifcfg-br0, ifcfg-br1, ifcfg-br2, and ifcfg-br3.
Edit the ifcfg-eth0, ifcfg-eth1, ifcfg-eth2, and ifcfg-eth3 files.

step.screen: &prompt.sudo;vi /etc/sysconfig/network/ifcfg-eth1 BOOTPROTO='static' BROADCAST='' ETHTOOL_OPTIONS='' IPADDR='192.168.24.132/24' (Configure the IP address of the MGMT Interface) MTU='' NETWORK='' REMOTE_IPADDR='' STARTMODE='auto'

&prompt.sudo;vi /etc/sysconfig/network/ifcfg-eth0 BOOTPROTO='static' BROADCAST='' ETHTOOL_OPTIONS='' IPADDR='192.168.32.15/24' ( Configure the IP address of the ESX_CONF Interface ) MTU='' NETWORK='' REMOTE_IPADDR='' STARTMODE='auto'
&prompt.sudo;vi /etc/sysconfig/network/ifcfg-eth2 BOOTPROTO='' BROADCAST='' ETHTOOL_OPTIONS='' IPADDR='' MTU='' NAME='VMXNET3 Ethernet Controller' NETWORK='' REMOTE_IPADDR='' STARTMODE='auto'
&prompt.sudo;vi /etc/sysconfig/network/ifcfg-eth3 BOOTPROTO='' BROADCAST='' ETHTOOL_OPTIONS='' IPADDR='' MTU='' NAME='VMXNET3 Ethernet Controller' NETWORK='' REMOTE_IPADDR='' STARTMODE='auto'

step.para: If the default route is not configured, add a default route file manually.
Create a file routes in /etc/sysconfig/network.
Edit the file to add your default route.
Add ardana user and home directory if that is not your default user. The username and password should be ardana/ardana.
Create a ardana usergroup in the VM if it does not exist.
Check for an existing ardana group.
Add ardana group if necessary.
Add ardana user to the ardana group.

Allow the ardana user to sudo without password. Setting up sudo on &slsa; is covered in the &suse; documentation at Configuring sudo. We recommend creating user specific sudo config files in the /etc/sudoers.d directory. Create an /etc/sudoers.d/ardana config file with the following content to allow sudo commands without the requirement of a password.
Add the Zypper repositories using the ISO-based repositories created previously. Change the value of deployer_ip if necessary.
Verify that the repositories have been added.
Set up SSH access that does not require a password.

When you have started the installation using the &clm; or if you are adding a &slsa; node to an existing cloud, the &clm; public key needs to be copied to the &slsa; node. You can do this by copying ~/.ssh/authorized_keys from another node in the cloud to the same location on the &slsa; node. If you are installing a new cloud, this file will be available on the nodes after running the bm-reimage.yml playbook.

important.para: Ensure that there is global read access to the file ~/.ssh/authorized_keys.

step.para: Test passwordless ssh from the &clm; and check your ability to remotely execute sudo commands.
Shutdown the VM and create a template out of the VM appliance for future use.
The VM Template will be saved in your vCenter Datacenter and you can view it from VMS and Templates menu.
